channel.title: Recent stuff
channel.description:
No one has really posted anything lately so i guess ill just post some random junk i've made. Not everythings finished.
Knife [img]http://img535.imageshack.us/img535/8300/knife.png[/img] [img]http://img98.imageshack.us/img98/6966/knife2.png[/img]
Marine i made forever ago that i tested clothing wrinkles on recently. Still need some work but they're getting better (believe me) [img]http://img94.imageshack.us/img94/9639/wrinkles.png[/img]
Low poly USP pistol, mainly focused on the detail on the top of the gun rather than the handle. The handle gets covered up anyway. I also wrote a tutorial on this. Bad picture really but cba to get another. [img]http://img237.imageshack.us/img237/3121/previewpz.jpg[/img]
WIP: SCAR h i started to fool around with [img]http://img175.imageshack.us/img175/9100/scar2.jpg[/img]
Finished ak - 47 [img]http://img138.imageshack.us/img138/9714/28073325.png[/img] [img]http://img30.imageshack.us/img30/2189/ak474.png[/img] [img]http://img709.imageshack.us/img709/1105/ak473.png[/img]
Recently re-installed VRay and was messing around with IES lighting (Mainly in the corner of the room) [img]http://img189.imageshack.us/img189/3194/room2.png[/img]

item.title: Recent stuff
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:26, topic:330243”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=426626.msg3134317#msg3134317 date=1266784565]

no on the personalize options the base is 2.26Ghz, the 2.53Ghz is an extra £70, you could spend that plus a bit more and get the extra 2GB of RAM

Ohhhh.
Nah, I wouldn’t tune it up to 2.53ghz, because the standard 2.26ghz processor can be turbo boosted to 2.53ghz anyway, that’s what I meant.
I would spend the extra bit of money on finger recognition, bluetooth and a backlit keyboard.
[/quote]
you dont need finger recognition, that is pointless as is the backlit keyboard, bluetooth has its uses though. You should be able to take the 2.26 and overclock it anyway this turbo boost id imagine runs off of percentages of the CPU so you’d up that limit as well, the Cooler should be able to keep it going up to 3Ghz i’d reckon, however thread derail :P[/quote]

But I love pointless things like that.

And indeed, on topic, I love the zoomed in image of the rusted(?) AK-47, although, I think you could tile the texture on the handle better.

Read full topic

I would spend the extra bit of money on finger recognition, bluetooth and a backlit keyboard.[/quote]

item.title: Recent stuff
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:21, topic:330243”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=426626.msg3134021#msg3134021 date=1266760591]

Desktops are so inconvenient.

hardly, i use mine predominantly plus if i had spent the same amount as i did on my desktop on a laptop the specs would be a lot lower, so why not get the most for your money?

I often move about with my laptop though, for example when I modelled all the furniture in my front room, I measured it all out with a tape measure then input the measurements into the program, just to make sure everything was proportioned correct.
Plus, what affects the render times?
The laptop I’m getting has a 1gb HD radeon graphics card, 4gb ram, and an Intel dual core i5 processor running at 2.53gHz, will play games like Modern Warfare 2 at 50 FPS.

for £800 in a laptop? link please
im running a 4870x2 and a 4870 in tri corssfire, bought them off my boss at work, 6GB 1600mhz ram, i7@3.4Ghz

http://www1.euro.dell.com/uk/en/home/Laptops/studio-1747/pd.aspx?refid=studio-1747&s=dhs&cs=ukdhs1
Top range one for £699, if you go on personalise then you can upgrade some of the components.

It has got £200 off it though, it’s on offer.

Benchmarks: http://www.notebookcheck.net/ATI-Mobility-Radeon-HD-5650.23697.0.html
[/quote]
why are you buying a highe clock CPU just buy the lower one (ie save cash) and OC it[/quote]

Do you mean why get the £699 instead of the £649?
Because it has an extra 1gb RAM and a 180gb bigger hard drive, it’s only £50 difference, no biggy.

Read full topic

item.title: Recent stuff
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:6, topic:330243”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=426626.msg3133482#msg3133482 date=1266703501]
These are all beautiful Frell.
I’ll be as good as you one day, getting an £800 laptop in the new few days so I can finally render scenes with skylight in less than two hours.

Ps. why didn’t you use smoothing on the hat and boots on the soldier? Would look better imo.
[/quote]
laptop for rendering? buy a desktop and render shit properly[/quote]

Frell:

Desktops are so inconvenient.

Then at least do what I do.

Mostly work from laptop. When it gets too heavy to work on, switch to a desktop or hide shit.

Rendering time: Use laptop to distribute rendering to desktop machine. You can use both computers or just delegate it all to the desktop.

I rarely use any of my desktops, so each of them is basically idling until I’m ready to render.

Read full topic

item.title: Recent stuff
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:13, topic:330243”][quote author=Frell link=topic=426626.msg3133664#msg3133664 date=1266714145]

The wood texturing on the AK is bad. The grain for the buttstock and handle should be switched.

Hard to find a wood texture to match a stock =\

Abe, theres no color on it.
[/quote]Too much brightness though.[/quote]
Its metal…

And under studio lights…

…

Read full topic

item.title: Recent stuff
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

The wood texture for the front grip looks fine. Just try making the grain on the handle vertical and the grain on the buttstock horizontal (i.e flip 90 degrees).

Read full topic
